concise_definition: n. 虚张声势, 欺骗; v. 虚张声势, 欺骗

definitions.explanation_en: A deceptive strategy or statement intended to make others believe something that is not true, often to gain an advantage in a competitive situation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种欺骗性的策略或言论，旨在让他人相信并非真实的事情，通常用于在竞争情境中获取优势。
definitions.example_en: His confident tone was just a bluff—he had no idea what the answer was.
definitions.example_cn: 他自信的语气只是虚张声势——他根本不知道答案是什么。

definitions.explanation_en: A steep cliff or bank, especially one overlooking a body of water or a valley; a geographical feature often used metaphorically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 陡峭的悬崖或河岸，尤其指俯瞰水域或山谷的地形；常被用作隐喻。
definitions.example_en: We stood at the edge of the bluff, watching the waves crash below.
definitions.example_cn: 我们站在悬崖边缘，看着下方的海浪猛烈拍打。

definitions.explanation_en: To deceive or mislead someone by pretending to have more strength, confidence, or knowledge than one actually does.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过假装拥有比实际更强的实力、信心或知识来欺骗或误导他人。
definitions.example_en: She bluffed her way through the interview by pretending to understand the technical jargon.
definitions.example_cn: 她假装懂那些专业术语，从而在面试中蒙混过关。

definitions.explanation_en: In poker or similar games, to bet heavily on a weak hand in order to make opponents fold.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在扑克或类似游戏中，用弱牌下大注，以迫使对手弃牌。
definitions.example_en: He bluffed with a pair of twos and won the pot when everyone else folded.
definitions.example_cn: 他用一对二虚张声势，当所有人都弃牌时赢得了底池。

comparison.analysis: “Deceive”（欺骗）是更广泛的术语，泛指任何使他人相信虚假信息的行为，不强调手段或动机。而 “bluff” 特指通过假装强大、自信或拥有更多信息来施加心理压力，常用于博弈或谈判语境，具有策略性和表演性。
“Lie”（撒谎）指直接说出不真实的话，通常带有道德贬义，强调内容的虚假性。而 “bluff” 不一定说假话，而是通过误导性姿态、语气或行为制造错觉，有时甚至使用真实信息来增强可信度，更具战术性。
“Intimidate”（恐吓）是通过威胁或施压使他人畏惧屈服，核心是制造恐惧。而 “bluff” 是通过伪装实力或信心来让对方主动退让，不依赖直接威胁，更依赖心理博弈和对方的判断失误。
